class Solution(object):
    def minOperations(self, nums1, nums2):
        """
        :type nums1: List[int]
        :type nums2: List[int]
        :rtype: int
        """
        swap_needed = 0
        max1, max2 = max(nums1), max(nums2)
        last1, last2 = nums1[-1], nums2[-1]
        
        # If both conditions are already met
        if last1 == max1 and last2 == max2:
            return 0
        
        # If swapping the last elements satisfies the condition
        if (last1 != max1 or last2 != max2) and (nums1[-1] < max2 or nums2[-1] < max1):
            nums1[-1], nums2[-1] = nums2[-1], nums1[-1]
            swap_needed += 1
            
            # Check if conditions are met after the swap
            if nums1[-1] == max(nums1) and nums2[-1] == max(nums2):
                return swap_needed
        
        # Sort both arrays to prepare for possible swaps
        nums1.sort()
        nums2.sort()
        
        # Check each element from the start to the second last
        for i in range(len(nums1) - 1):
            if nums1[i] < nums2[i]:
                nums1[i], nums2[i] = nums2[i], nums1[i]
                swap_needed += 1
                
                # Check if conditions are met after each swap
                if nums1[-1] == max(nums1) and nums2[-1] == max(nums2):
                    return swap_needed
        
        # Final check if conditions are met
        if nums1[-1] == max(nums1) and nums2[-1] == max(nums2):
            return swap_needed
        else:
            return -1
